About

Introduction

Hi, my name is Joseph Driedger.

Early Struggles

I was diagnosed with Autism when I was three years old. It caused severe social anxiety and speach delays. I wasn't able to talk until I was 7 years old and severely struggled in elementary school academically. It wasn't until middle school that I became a straight A student and discovered my passions in technology, video games, and music.

Taekwondo

A fourth-degree black belt, 6-time Canada Champion, 2-time District Champion, and certified instructor in White Rock, BC building discipline, teamwork, and confidence in kids, teens, and adults through taekwondo.

Music

Music has always been a passion of mine. From a young age, I formed a bond with piano and vocals. It translated into being a top music student in high school winning 5 music awards and 2 school nominations for the Surrey Jazz Festivals' Rep Band. Now currently singing for the Cloverdale Chordsmen, forming beautiful harmonies and chords with other barbershop singers.

University

Currently studing Computer Systems at BCIT (British Columbia Institute of Technology).
